thread.title_full: Nina Dobrev puts on thigh-skimming display in green dress | Daily Mail Online

author: Dan Cain For Mailonline
title: Nina Dobrev puts on thigh-skimming display in green dress | Daily Mail Online
text: Share 177 shares The film's leading man, Vin Diesel, couldn't be missed in a multi-textured woolen jacket which he matched with cream trousers and black boots. He made two reverse peace signs and smiled for the cameras as he posed in front of the branded hoardings. Stunning: She confidently displayed her lithe limbs in the green garment which she teamed with metallic heels Sitting pretty: The actress wowed in a thigh-skimming patterned dress with an elaborate cut out section in the bodice X marks the spot: Kris Wu, Vin Diesel and Nina posed in front of a full auditorium Action man: The film's leading man couldn't be missed in a multi-textured woolen jacket which he matched with cream trousers and black boots Snap happy: The gravelly-voiced star sported mirrored aviators and posed for plenty of smiley selfies with his adoring Chinese fans The gravelly-voiced star sported mirrored aviators and posed for plenty of smiley selfies with his adoring Chinese fans. Indian actress Deepika Padukone looked elegant in a flowing cream halter-neck gown, posing up a storm as the sun shone down. Home favourite Donnie Yen cut a dapper figure in a checked jacket and a black roll-neck and signed plenty of autographs. Fan favourite: The crowd scrambled to get a glimpse of their hero Screen star: Indian actress Deepika Padukone looked elegant in a flowing cream halter-neck gown, posing up a storm as the sun shone down On the promo trail: The cast discussed the film in front of a live audience The sequel marks Diesel's return to the series 15 years after he starred in the first film. The new flick stars an assortment of international stars including Deepika, Donnie, Tony Jaa, Nina, Ruby Rose and Samuel L. Jackson. It sees Diesel recruit a new batch of accomplices as he looks to recover Pandora's Box, a deadly weapon that controls every military satellite in the world. Man of the people: Home favourite Donnie Yen cut a dapper figure in a checked jacket and a black roll-neck and signed plenty of autographs Strike a pose: Martial artist Donnie certainly looked cool on arrival Share or comment on this article 177
